page.title: 09Health care on Papa Westray
page.content: Health care is practised by a resident Health Visitor. A doctor from Westray is on call and travels across by small boat weather permitting, the doctor holds a surgery once a week. A Flying Ambulance is used should the situation merit a visit to the main hospital in Kirkwall or direct to Aberdeen. Annual or Biannual visits are made by the dentist who uses the doctors surgery and the school dentist who brings his own mobile clinic, the optician and the chiropodist. The physiotherapist visits the island as required as does the speech therapist. Home help service is supplied to extend care of the elderly within the community.
